md:
giải nghĩa từ "leap" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

* Leap (verb) - Nhảy, Đánh bật
	+ Meaning: to jump or spring a long way, often suddenly and quickly.
	+ Example: The athlete took a leap of faith and jumped over the hurdle.
	+ Related words: jump, spring, bound, hop

* Leap (noun) - Nhảy, Đánh bật
	+ Meaning: a sudden and quick jump or movement.
	+ Example: The leap of the dancer was impressive and got a lot of applause.
	+ Related words: jump, spring, bound, hop

* Leap year - Năm nhuận
	+ Meaning: a year that has 366 days, instead of the usual 365 days.
	+ Example: We have to adjust our calendar every leap year to keep it in sync with the Earth's orbit.
	+ Related words: year, calendar, orbit

* Leap of faith - Nhảy của đức tin
	+ Meaning: an act of believing or trusting in something without having any proof or evidence.
	+ Example: It took a leap of faith to start my own business, but it paid off in the end.
	+ Related words: faith, trust, believe, risk
html:
giải nghĩa từ "leap" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  • Leap (verb) - Nhảy, Đánh bật

    • Meaning: to jump or spring a long way, often suddenly and quickly.
    • Example: The athlete took a leap of faith and jumped over the hurdle.
    • Related words: jump, spring, bound, hop

  • Leap (noun) - Nhảy, Đánh bật

    • Meaning: a sudden and quick jump or movement.
    • Example: The leap of the dancer was impressive and got a lot of applause.
    • Related words: jump, spring, bound, hop

  • Leap year - Năm nhuận

    • Meaning: a year that has 366 days, instead of the usual 365 days.
    • Example: We have to adjust our calendar every leap year to keep it in sync with the Earth's orbit.
    • Related words: year, calendar, orbit

  • Leap of faith - Nhảy của đức tin

    • Meaning: an act of believing or trusting in something without having any proof or evidence.
    • Example: It took a leap of faith to start my own business, but it paid off in the end.
    • Related words: faith, trust, believe, risk
